Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2007 10:38PM sheren1954 wrote: Thanks for the information. My surgeon did tell me that I'll have more tests to make sure it hasn't spread anywhere else. I am so grateful to have a job where I can work from home some days. And very grateful to have found this web site!!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed today sheren1954 ilenee

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2007 06:54AM sheren1954 wrote: I just seen my onc. doctor today. Also had a bone scan and the tech gave me my own films...was glad for that. Had a lot of labs drawn including a tumor marker. Reality just sets in more and more everyday. He ordered a PET scan, and MUGA scan. Surgery is scheduled for Nov. 13th. He said depending on what the PET scan shows he may need to delay the surgery....checking for any further lymph node involvement. Also asked him about the insulin potentiation therapy. He says there has only been study about this and its from Uraguay. Nothing proven, and the study did not follow the participents long term. He advised against it because there is no scientific proof that it works. He recommended to me to stay on my vitamins, PC-95, COQ10, multiple vitamin, and calcium with vit D. Anything with anti-oxidates in them I cannot take when it gets closer to doing the chemo. I really like him and feel like I can trust him. That's half the battle. Will let everyone know my results...still feel like I'm in limbo.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed today sheren1954 ilenee

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2007 04:20AM sheren1954 wrote: My hsuband had me speak to an osteopathic doctor yesterday. Says I should be going through insulin potentiation therapy along with low dose chemo. Anyone heard of this?
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed today sheren1954 ilenee

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2007 11:25AM sheren1954 wrote: Thanks everyone for your kind words of support. I just seen my radiology oncologist today. He told me that I have "triple neg. breast cancer." Is anyone familiar with this? I know that its estrogen receptor neg, progesterone receptor neg and HER2 neg. I have a 2.9 cm mass, and 2 + axillary lymph nodes. Everything I'm reading is telling me that this is an aggressive type of breast cancer. I have had some hip pain for several months now. So, I'm having a bone scan on Nov.2  I don't think I've been this scared in a very long time. I can't find anything about this cancer on this site.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed today sheren1954 ilenee

Posts.Content: sheren1954 wrote: Hello eveyone, Just diagnosed today. So much information was coming at me that I don't even know what stage I'm in. I do have lymph node involvement and can actually feel the mass on my left breast extending under my arm. I can't finish a meal...weird, I'm not hungry and haven't been for several weeks. Is this part of the diagnosis? I can eat a little and start feeling sick to my stomach part way through then push my food away. I have to have an MRI tomorrow to see if the cancer has spread to my right breast. Then I see a radiology oncologist on Wednesday. Things are happening pretty fast and I'm really scared!!! Posts.Content: sheren1954 wrote: I was diagnosed with triple neg breast cancer when I seen my rad. oncologist today.  I found out about the + cancer and + 2 lymph nodes on Monday. Today one of my doctors says that its triple negative breast cancer. Really scared now. Anyone out there that has this, knows anything about it?? I was told that surgery, chemo and radiation are my best choices.  My bilateral MRI does not show my right breast with any disease...just my left breast. I am thinking of a mastectomy instead of lumpectomy....not sure which road to take. Log in to post a reply
